sn45.140:4.1: The footprints of all creatures that walk can fit inside an elephant’s footprint.
sn45.140:4.2: So an elephant’s footprint is said to be the biggest of them all.
sn45.140:4.4: In the same way, all wholesome qualities are rooted in diligence and meet at diligence,
sn45.140:4.5: and diligence is said to be the best of them.
sn45.140:4.6: A mendicant who is diligent can expect to
sn45.140:4.7: develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path.
sn45.140:4.8: And how does a mendicant who is diligent develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path?
sn45.140:4.9: It’s when a mendicant develops right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,
sn45.140:4.10: and right samādhi, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn45.140:4.11: That’s how a mendicant who is diligent develops and cultivates the noble eightfold path.”
